questions.question: A main idea is sometimes found

choices.answer: In the first sentence of a paragraph
In the last sentence of a paragraph
Somewhere in the middle of a paragraph
by making one up based on the ideas in the paragraph

questions.question: What is the main idea of My Little Pony: Friendship is magic

choices.answer: Twilight Sparkle studies the magic of friendship
I literally have no idea
Ponies and rainbows and stuff
Princess Celetia is there

questions.question: What best describes a main idea?

choices.answer: A supporting detail
A broad topic
A central point
A statement of opinion

questions.question: The main idea of Bridge to Terabithia is...

choices.answer: A boy spends days constructing a bridge over a river
Imaginary friends
Batman comes to Terabithia to bring justice
Two kids imagine a fantasy world to escape reality

questions.question: An essay you read explains that healthy foods are good for you, what would the TOPIC be...

choices.answer: Healthy foods include fruits, vegetables, and lean protein
Healthy foods
Eating healthy foods are good for you
Eating is necessary to sustain life

questions.question: In the same article about healthy foods, what would the main idea be?

choices.answer: Healthy foods include fruits, vegetables, and lean protein
Healthy foods
Eating healthy foods is good for you
Eating is necessary to sustain life

questions.question: The main idea of the book & movie Holes is...

choices.answer: Never take advantage of a fortune teller
How to properly dig a hole 5 feet wide and 5 feet deep
A boy is sent to a camp to dig holes for a mysterious reason
Boy wonders why his last name is his first name backwards

questions.question: If you can't figure out what the main idea is, what should you do?

choices.answer: Try to recall every detail of the passage
Ask yourself general questions about the passage
Read the passage once and never look at it again
Read the passage over & over again until you memorize it

questions.question: What is an inference you can make about main ideas in writing?

choices.answer: They're always based on fact, never opinion
To be effective they must be supported by facts
In many essays, they have nothing to do with the topic
Most pieces of writing lack main ideas

questions.question: Bonus Question: Which teacher did I (Mr. Campbell) have when I went to YES?

choices.answer: Mrs. Swander
Mrs. Stagge
Mrs. Riegle
Mr. Kerkhoff
